bibl.title: Letter from James F. Minor to Philip Showalter Hench, March 25, 1948

div1.p: Minor invites Hench to give his lecture on Walter Reed to the Albemarle County Historical Society.

div1.head: Letter from James F. Minor to Philip Showalter Hench, March 25, 1948
div1.opener:
ALBEMARLE COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY
Organized 1940
CHARLOTTESVILLE, VIRGINIA
March 25, 1948
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We are extending you a cordial invitation to deliver your
lecture on Dr. Walter Reed before the Albemarle County
Historical Society at its next meeting, which will be
Monday, May 10th at 8:00 P.M.

As soon as the board learned from your brother, Dr. A. L.
Hench, that you could come to us at that time, they voted
unanimously to take advantage of your kind offer.

The meeting will be held in the County Court House, seating
200 people or more, and if you will let us know any necessary
preparation that has to be made, we will try to attend to it.

Looking forward with great pleasure to having you give this
address, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, James F. Minor,
President. JFM/vmt
